title.narrative: Core Support Georgian Foundation of Strategic and International Studies
Core support Georgian Foundation of Strategic and International Studies

description.narrative: GFSIS defines its its long term goal and objective as supporting of building of a democratic Georgia, integrated into European and Euro-Atlantic structures. For achieving this goal GFSIS uses its strategic thematic directions and methodology as interconnected building blocks. GFSIS strategic thematic directions are in the areas of foreign policy/national security, state building, conflict resolution and European integration. Within the strategic areas GFSIS carries out three blocks of activities a) teaching and training, b) analytical work, c) public outreach and awareness raising. Activities target opinion and decisions makers, including public servants, media, ethnic minorities, journalists and political party staffers, civil society and clerics. Those activities should help GFSIS in their objectives to a) Support to the reinforcement of Georgian institutions, b) Enhancing national security and c) Support to the Georgia´s integration in European and Euro-Atlantic structures.

GFSIS är en ideell georgisk tankesmedja vars syfte är att förbättra samhällsstyrning och introducera policybaserat beslutsfattande genom forskning och analys, utbildning av beslutsfattare och utbildningsinsatser inom regionala och internationella strategifrågor.
GFSIS arbetar med stadstjänstemän, etniska och religiösa minoriterer och med olika samhällsgrupper, exempelvis politiska partier, journalister och den georgiska ortodoxa kyrkan.
Den föreslagna insatsen är ett kärnstöd som möjliggör fullföljandet av GFSIS verksamhet samt syftar till att stärka organisationen. Stödet har tre huvudinriktningar: utbildning och kompetensutveckling, forskning och analys samt ökat informations- och påverkansarbete. Projektaktiviteter förväntas leda till förbättrad samhällstyrning och policybaserat beslutsfattande. Ett av GFSIS huvudmål är att stödja konfliktprevention och fredsansträngningar i regionen.Stödets huvudsakligamål är att bidra till formulering av en gemensam uppfattning av de värden och prioriteteringar som är viktiga för Georgiens EU-närmande.
Ansökan som kommit in från GFSIS 2015 var på fyra år med ett totalt belopp på 20 000 000 SEK. På grund av neddragning av anslaget för Georgien valde Sida att stödja organisationen under två år (2015-2017) och indikerade möjligheten till att besluta om en förlängning med ytterligare två år, beroende på tilldelning av medel framöver och resultatet av utvärderingen, som var planerad under 2017. Sedan beslutet om kärnstöd till GFSIS 2015-2017, daterat 3 juli 2015 har avtalet ändrats två gånger: den1 mars 2016 i avsikt att bevilja vidareförmedling av medel och 14 juni 2017 i syfte att förlänga aktivitetsperioden till 30 september 2017.
I april 2017 genomförde ambassaden en extern utvärdering av projektet. Projektet bedömdes som positivt och utvärderingsgruppen rekommenderade att förlänga kärnstödet till GFSIS med ytterligare en fas. I maj 2017 ansökte GFSIS om en kostnadsförlängning av projektet till slutet på 2020.
Sida bedömde GFSIS ansökan som relevant och har beslutat att förbereda ett tilläggsbeslut och bevilja GFSIS en kostnadsförlängning till 31 december 2020 med en budget på 12 000 000 SEK. Den nya totala budgeten för projektet är 22 300 000.

Georgian Foundation for Strategic and International Studies (GFSIS) mission defined as not-for-profit think tank dedicated to improvement of good governance practises and introducing policy based decision making culture in Georgia through research and analyses, training of policy makers and policy analyses and public education about strategic issues - both domestic and international.
GFSIS works with public servants, ethnic and religious minorities and other parts of the society, like political parties, journalists, Georgian orthodox church.
The intervention provides to the beneficiary NGO a core support that would allow it to act according to is charter as a think-tank and improve sustainability of the organisation.
The support provided will enable GFSIS to continue activities in three directions a) teaching and training, b) research and analysis and c) public outreach and awareness raising. Those activities should result into improvement of good governance practices and introducing policy based decisionmaking culture. One of the objectives of the GFSIS is to support conflict prevention and peace building efforts in the region. Overall objective of the contribution is to contribute towards formulating a common understanding of values and priorities that should guide Georgia towards its ambition to join Euro-Atlantic family.
The initial application submitted by GFSIS 2015 was for four years with a total amount 20 000 000 SEK. Because of cuts in the appropriation for Georgia, Sida decided to support the organisation for two years (2015-2017) and indicated a possibility of extending the support with two more years depending on future allocation of funds and the findings of the evaluation planned to be conducted during 2017. Since the decision on contribution, dated 3 July 2015, the agreement has been amended twice, on 1 March 2016, with the decision to approve forwarding of funds and on 14 June 2017, with the decision to grant a no-cost extension of the project until 30 September 2017.
In April 2017 the embassy commissioned an external evaluation of the project. The overall assessment of the project was positive and the evaluation team recommended providing core support to GFSIS for one more phase. In May 2017 GFSIS submitted a proposal for a cost-extension of the contribution until the end of 2020.
The embassy has assesssed the proposal submitted by GFSIS as relevant and has decided to prepare a supplementary decision and grant GFSIS a cost-extension until 31 December, 2020 with a budget of 12 000 000 SEK. The new total budget for the intervention will be 22 300 000 SEK.

description.narrative: GFSIS as usual provided with rather detailed annual report that gives good picture what was done in the reporting period - 2021. The main results for the objectives a) Support to the reinforcement of Georgian institutions, b) Enhancing national security and c) Support to the Georgia´s integration in European and Euro-Atlantic structures are as follows: Under the Objective One - supporting reinforcement of Georgian institutions in addition to its flagship capacity building programs in policy analysis, national security and cybersecurity, human resource management and foreign policy, GFSIS launched a new training program for civil servants in partnership with the Estonian School of diplomacy (ESD). Within this reporting period ninety more public servants, twenty-nine political party staffers and twenty-five representatives of clergy and more than fifty students from GOC affiliated higher education institutions took part in capacity building programs. In order to contribute to an informed policy-making process and Georgias Euro-Atlantic integration, GFSIS continued close cooperation with German Marshal Fund U.S. through online closed discussions about the developments in Georgia and the region. At the same time the President of the Foundation with Georgian counterparts traveled to Washington D.C. and Brussels to brief Georgias partners about recent developments within the country and the region. Under the Objective Two GFSIS continued to act to support inclusion of ethnic and religious minority communities through a number of ongoing programs. Throughout 2021 activities carried out by GFSIS include: a series of nation-wide and capacitybuilding seminars and summer schools for minority youth, thematic meetings and roundtable discussions with ethnic and religious minority opinion and decision-makers as well as religious leaders, radio discussions in minority populated regions. The Foundation further contributed to the process of strengthening cooperation and networking among the party staffers and national minority activists and youth in order to carry out constructive dialogue on the disputed issues and enhance their involvement in political life of the country. In 2021 with national minorities including the youth segment remained the biggest group of stakeholders with the total number reaching 650. During this reporting period GFSIS continued investing in the young generation as the future elite of Georgia and overall contributing to societal resilience. Over the years it has been gradually increasing its informal education activities in the regions: Khulo municipality, Mountainous Adjara, Samtskhe-Javakheti region namely Adigeni, Mokhe and Zarzma Pankisi Gorge, Kvemo Kartli, Samegrelo, Guria, as well as Tserovani IDP settlement across the ABL. The Foundation has put much effort throughout this reporting year as well to raise awareness of the local communities on Russian antiwestern propaganda and NATO and EU integration related topics. Objective three - Throughout this reporting year GFSIS was actively participating and contributing to the work of Eastern Partnership Civil Society Forum (EaP CSF) National Platform of Georgia. Organization participated in elaboration of a set of papers on Economic Development of Georgia, in particular, conducted research and developed a paper on EU-Georgia trade relations; submitted recommendations on using the advantages of DCFTA; contributed to the relevant advocacy meetings. Additionally, GFSIS contributed to the research conducted by four Georgian (OSGF, GRASS, Mikeladze Foundation, GCSD), one Ukrainian (Renaissance Foundation) and one Moldovan (IPRE) organizations, exploring ways of cooperation among newly established Association TRIO (Ukraine, Moldova, Georgia). The research resulted in the development of the Food for Thought Paper, which was widely disseminated and presented to the national governments, parliaments, EU institutions, civil society organizations.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
